title: Primera División de México Apertura 2003
text:
Primera División de México "(Mexican First Division)" Apertura 2003 is a Mexican <a href="football%20%28soccer%29">football</a> tournament - one of two short tournaments that take up the entire year to determine the champion(s) of Mexican football. It began on Saturday 2 August 2003, and ran until 22 November, when the regular season ended. <a href="Irapuato%20F.C.">Irapuato</a> was promoted to the <a href="Primera%20Divisi%C3%B3n%20de%20M%C3%A9xico">Primera División de México</a> to play this tournament, and <a href="Colibr%C3%ADes%20de%20Morelos">Cuernavaca</a> was to be relegated to the <a href="Ascenso%20MX">Primera División A</a>. The Cuernavaca did not get to play in Primera A, though, as the team was disbanded by <a href="Federacion%20Mexicana%20de%20Futbol">FMF</a>. On 20 December, <a href="C.F.%20Pachuca">Pachuca</a> defeated <a href="Tigres%20UANL">Tigres UANL</a> and became champions for the third time.
